lead_paragraph: CUNNINGHAM--Bill. The Trustees and Staff of the New-York Historical Society mourn the passing of Bill Cunningham, a dear friend of our institution and great New York icon. Bill's association with New-York Historical began nearly fifty years ago with research in our Patricia D. Klingenstein Library relating to "Facades," an eight-year project that documented the architectural riches and fashion history of New York City. We were honored to celebrate the opening of a new exhibition of "Facades" in 2014 with photographs Bill gifted to us, on his 85th birthday. We will always recall Bill telling the guests, "I just have fun whatever I'm doing. Otherwise, it's not worth doing... Money isn't worth it. It's much better to go out and do what you want." Our hearts go out to Bill's devoted friend John Kurdewan at the New York Times, and to his extended family. Pam B. Schafler, Chair Richard Reiss, Vice Chair Roger Hertog, Executive Committee Chairman Louise Mirrer, President & CEO Valerie Paley, Vice President & "Facades" curator 1/3
